entries.label: Tetris Flip
entries.description: A simple tetris game but with two mischievous characters messing with the board, flipping it horizontally or vertically.
points: Just for fun, I wanted to try recreating Tetris

entries.label: Wronged Travel
entries.description: You, a traveller, get yourself involved with a some thugs on the streets tell you to give them your belongings.  After beating 'em up, a hunter comes across and somehow misunderstands the situation.. Thinking that you're the thug trying to take the local's belongings. Things escalate and now the authorities are after you..
points: In this game I tried exploring how to develop 2D games where the characters can move on both Axis, X and Y
Exploring algorithms to handle different enemy AI state behaviours

entries.label: Samurai Cut
entries.description: A Samurai on a journey encountering rivals and obstacles.
points: A simple endless runner game exploring the style of mixing 2D sprites with the 3D environment

entries.label: Final Test Subject
entries.description: As the final robot creation in the lab, you are tasked to clear and  survive through multiple rooms packed with robots that are also tasked  to destroy you.
points: A project where I played around with more of Unity’s features
In the project, I explored more about Unity’s Job and Burst System to handle A* Pathfinding Algorithm and explored more about Unity’s baked lighting system

entries.label: Riot Shield
entries.description: An endless runner game where you, as a Swat are tasked with destroying  everything that comes in your path except a few things. As you destroy  these objects, you will gain points to beat your own high score and gain coins to upgrade yourself and buy 5 other Swats from around the world.
points: Project was created for an assessment during university but a friend and I decided to continue updating it after graduating

entries.label: Custom Youtube Feed
entries.description: Wanted to create custom feed that has more control over what I want to see and how I want to see it.
points: Created mock-ups of the feed in Figma
Used Flutter to implement the feed
Using Python as the backend to scrape the data from YouTube and receiving push notifications when new videos are uploaded via Youtube's PubSub API
Using Supabase as the database to store the data
